title: Education on Building Social Science Research Support Systems Through Online Database Programming

context.prior_knowledge: Requires intermediate-level theoretical background and practical experience. Foundational understanding of social science research methodologies (sampling, variable control, etc.)
context.additional_context: A competency-enhancement program for pre-service and in-service teachers, combining VR simulations and microlearning content in smartphone-limited environments. It aims to improve data utilization skills in social studies education through practice-oriented training.

learning_goals: Learners will explain database design principles (normalization, ERD creation) for social science data management through 10-minute microlearning modules.
Learners will apply SQL query writing and execution in a VR-based simulation to real-world social science scenarios (demographics, cultural resources).

Learners will design and implement a small-scale social science research support application (CRUD functionality) with ≥3 tables using SQL basics and database design knowledge acquired from microlearning over a 2-week project. The final output must pass a functionality test (≥80% success) and peer evaluation (≥4/5).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
